attributes.action: Repeal the change of 20 mph to the main roads around London.
attributes.additional_details:
Driving in London become unbearable as the traffic queues are getting longer and longer.

Repeal the 20mph and re-introduce 30mph where is appropriate.
attributes.background: To make sure we have 30mph or 40mph to the main roads and introduce 20mph where appropriate such as outside the schools and residential areas.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Speed limits on roads managed by Transport for London are the responsibility of the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

You could raise this issue with a London Assembly Member who represents you.  You can find out who they are and how to contact them here: https://www.london.gov.uk/who-we-are/what-london-assembly-does/london-assembly-members

You could also raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
